name: Vip
body:
### Week 1
- Get familiar with D3JS
- Project Goal
Author your page content here [using GitHub Flavored Markdown](https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/)

### Week 2
- Read code from last semester and summer
- Understand pros and cons of the past project 
- Take one of the input data sets in csv format and print a table

### Week 3
- Continued last weeks task
- Set up IIS server on the Windows machine to be able to upload host website
- Apache server on Linux for convenience
- Set up a Github repository 

### Week 4
- Use the same csv from the past 2 weeks and make a stacked bar chart in d3js
- Make search function to extract specific ID
- The ID being compared should go to the bottom of the stack for easy comparison

### Week 5
- Host the website on [Purdue server](http://web.ics.purdue.edu/~awairaga/)
- Host the weekly blog and the website on [Github](http://apoorvvw.github.io/VIP)
- Practice D3JS and continue last times task


You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor’s GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out our [documentation](https://help.github.com/pages) or [contact support](https://github.com/contact) and we’ll help you sort it out.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
